note:
Name:  ___              Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   F
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
Morphine Sulfate / adhesive
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
LLE pain
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
None
 
History of Present Illness:
___ h/o AF, HF, ___ cirrhosis, renal transplant x2, DM2 and 
recent admission for acute on chronic CHF exacerbation, presents 
from home with a fall resulting in a nondisplaced  fracture of 
the lateral left femoral metadiaphysis. She was packing for her 
trip to ___ when she slipped and fall. She denies 
syncope, pre-syncope, dizziness, lightheadedness, palpitations, 
SOB prior to the fall. This was evaluated by orthopedics who 
recommended ___ brace and no surgical intervention. 
Patient's pain was managed in ED with intermittent oxycodone. 
She was evaluated by ___ who recommended rehab. Patient admitted 
to medicine for placement to rehab.
 
Of note, the patient was recently admitted to ___ for an acute 
on chronic CHF exacerbation. At that time she was found to have 
a newly reduced ejection fraction to 35%. She was diuresed to 
dry weight and her course was complicated by ___ in the setting 
of diuresis. Given her h/o renal transplant, renal was following 
as well.

Upon arrival to the floor, patient reports she is feeling ok. 
She has some left leg pain but it is manageable. She denies sob, 
cp, nausea, abdominal pain, dizziness.

ROS: Positive per HPI. Remaining 10 point ROS reviewed and 
negative
 
Past Medical History:
1) atrial fibrillation/atrial flutter diagnosed in ___ this
year. She underwent unsuccessful DCCV on ___.
2) coronary artery disease status post stenting of the RI with
3.0x13 mm Tetra stent and the OM2 with a 2.5 x 13 Tetra stent in
___ with a repeat catheterization in ___ showing proximal LAD
with 50% stenosis, (this was done after a stress test showed
moderate inferobasilar partial defect)
3) hypertension
4) diabetes
5) CKD status post two renal transplants, most recently in ___.
Her last creatinine was 1.3
6) hyperlipidemia
7) peripheral arterial disease with right femoral and 
retroaortic
left iliac bypass grafting as part of her renal transplant
surgery in ___. The graft is located in the left lower
quadrant. 
8) pancreatic cysts
9) history of positional vertigo
10) history of pachymeningitis
11) Cirrhosis of the liver diagnosed in ___, likely NASH
complicated with ascites and peripheral edema being managed with
diuresis.
12). Syncope - associated with lying on  her left side.
 
Social History:
___
Family History:
Mother died at age ___ of CAD and Diabetes.  Father died at age 
___ of kidney cancer.  He had an MI in his ___.  Maternal aunt 
and first cousin with thyroid cancer. MGF had MI in ___

Vitals: 98.8 PO 114 / 65 60 17 96    
GENERAL: chronically ill appearing woman in NAD. Oriented x3.

HEENT: Normocephalic atraumatic. Sclera anicteric. PERRL. EOMI.

bases

(+) periumbilical hernia that is reducible. non tender
EXTREMITIES: trace edema w/ compression stockings in place, left 
leg w/ ___ brace in place. can move toes and has sensation.

Imaging: 
XRAY Hip: A large left knee lipohemarthrosis indicates the 
presence of a fracture,  probably the lateral aspect of the 
distal left femoral metaphysis. 
  
CT C-spine: 
1. No evidence of fracture or traumatic malalignment.  Minimal 
retrolisthesis of C4 on C5 is likely chronic given adjacent 
degenerative changes. 
2. Mild cervical spondylosis with as much as mild spinal canal 
narrowing as described in the findings. 
3. Possible mild interstitial pulmonary edema. 

CT Head:
1. No evidence of an acute intracranial abnormality on 
noncontrast head CT.  Specifically no intracranial hemorrhage. 
2. Right frontal vertex scalp laceration without underlying 
calvarial 
fracture. 

CT LLE:
There is a subtle, nondisplaced fracture extending from the 
lateral aspect of the distal left femoral metadiaphysis 
inferiorly and medially to the 
superolateral margin of the femoral component knee arthroplasty 
hardware.  No other fracture identified. Large lipohemarthrosis. 


MICRO
___ URINE URINE CULTURE- NGTD

 
Brief Hospital Course:
___ h/o AF, HF, ___ cirrhosis, renal transplant x2, DM2 and 
recent admission for acute on chronic CHF exacerbation, presents 
from home with a fall resulting in a nondisplaced  fracture of 
the lateral left femoral metadiaphysis with ___ brace and 
awaiting rehab. 

Acute Issues:
# FEMORAL FRACTURE
# MECHANICAL FALL: The patien fell while packing for a trip to 
___ to see family. She reported that she just slipped. 
Nondisplaced periprosthetic lateral femoral condyle fracture. 
Closed injury and neurovascularly intact.  Seen by orthopedics 
in the ED and they recommended touch down weight bearing in the 
LLE in unlocked ___ brace at all times, and range of motion 
as tolerated. ___ saw her and recommended rehab. She will need 
f/U with Orthopaedic trauma clinic in 2 wks.  Ensure ca/vit D 
and consider bisphos and DEXA as outpatient.

#  CHRONIC SYSTOLIC HEART FAILURE 
She was just discharged from heart failure service on ___ for 
admission with newly reduced ejection fraction to 35% most 
likely secondary to CAD with new wall  motion abnormalities but 
possibly exacerbated by tachycardia. She was discharged with 
torsemide 60mg PO Daily, with a plan to restart spironolactone 
and losartan as an outpatient pending stable renal function. 
Discharge weight 63.1 kg (139.11 lb).
 - Preload: PO torsemide 80mg daily
 - Afterload: Losartan stopped when developed worsening ___ on 
___
 - Neurohormonal: metoprolol XL 25mg BID, started on 
spironolactone 12.5 mg daily.

#CP/CAD/HL/PAD: During last admission (discharged ___, TTE 
performed that showed new WMA  with hypokinesis of the basal and 
mid septum, inferior, and inferolateral segments and depressed 
EF to 35%. She was continued on her metoprolol, aspirin, statin, 
imdur. She will need repeat TTE in 1 month to assess focal wall 
motion abn. Losartan being held in the setting ___ and 
normotension.

# NASH cirrhosis: Stable throughout this admission

# Atrial fibrillation/flutter:  Rate controlled on metoprolol 
XL. She remained off amio for toxicity i/s/o  cirrhosis. Had 
rates in ___ at time of last discharge.  She was continued on 
her apixaban 5 mg bid and metoprolol XL 25 mg BID. She still had 
a ZIO patch on from the last admission, to be followed by 
outpatient cardiology.

#ESRD secondary to IgA nephropathy now s/p renal transplant x2: 
Cr 1.3 on prior discharge due to overdiuresis. On admission Cr 
1.1, back to baseline. Creatinine 1.0 on discharge. COntinued on 
his home immunosuppressants. Renal transplant followed.

#NIDDM: A1C 5.91 ___. Held oral medications during 
admission and on ISS while admitted. restarted on metformin and 
repaglinide on discharge.

#Hypothyroid: Continued on levothyroxine 150 mcg daily 

TRANSITIONAL ISSUES 
===================
[] F/U CHEM-10, CBC with Diff, Rapamycin level on ___ to be 
sent to Dr. ___ (Telephone: ___, Fax: 
___)
[] Patient WBC below baseline - diff pending with renal 
transplant team to follow up
[] Repeat TTE in 1 month (___) to assess for return in EF. 
Consider stress test vs. coronary angiography at that time to 
assess for CAD.
[] Repeat thyroid function tests near ___, adjust 
levothyroxine dose accordingly, please send results to Dr. 
___
[] Follow up ZIO monitor to assess burden of tachyarrhythmia
[] Fracture from standing height. Will need to discuss 
bisphosphonate treatment with her endocrinologist Dr. ___. She 
should be maintained on calcium and vitamin D
[] She will need f/U with Orthopaedic trauma clinic as above

Greater than 30 minutes spent in care coordination and 
counseling on the day of discharge.

___

Secondary: chronic systolic CHF, history of renal transplant, 
___ cirrhosis

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Out of Bed with assistance to chair or 
wheelchair.

 
Discharge Instructions:
Dear Ms. ___,

You were admitted to ___ because you fell and broke your leg. 
You were placed in a brace and our physical therapists felt that 
you should go to rehab to get stronger.

Please see below for your follow up appointments and 
medications. We changed some of the medications for your heart, 
so it is very important that you review your medication list 
carefully. Your rehab will arrange for follow up with your PCP.

We wish you all the best.

Sincerely,

Your care team at ___
 
Followup Instructions:
___

qafib.question: Does the note describe the patient as having permanent, paroxysmal, or persistent afib?

qprior_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having a stroke or transient ischemic attack?

qarterial_hypertension.question: Does the note describe the patient as having arterial hypertension on treatment (high bp e.g. >140, or HTN)?

qt2d.question: Does the note describe the patient as having Diabetes mellitus (DM1, DM2, T2D, T1DM, T2DM)?

qheart_failure.question: Does the note describe the patient as having heart failure?

qsurgical_valvular_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having valvular disease requiring surgery (stenosis)?

qafib_ablation.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a planned or past ablation procedure for afib?

qbleeding.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a serious bleeding in the past 6 months?

qpeptic_ulcer_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having peptic ulcer disease?

qrecent_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a stroke during this admission or within the last month? (Answer yes for any recent stroke if the date is unclear)

qhemorrhagic.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having any hemorrhagic tendencies or blood dyscrasias?

qbipolar.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with bipolar disorder?

qschizophrenia.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with schizophrenia or any schizoaffective disorders?

qmdd.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with depression or major depressive disorder (MDD)?

qmed_decisions.question: Does the note describe the patient as being unable to make medical decisions? (Answer no unless there is evidence the patient cannot make their own medical decisions).

qchads2.question: What is the highest CHADS2 score mentioned? Answer "NA" if no CHADS2 score is in the note.

qblood_glucose.question: What is the highest blood glucose lab mentioned? Answer "NA" if no blood glucose score is in the note.

qlvef.question: What is the lowest left ventricular ejection (LVEF, ef, ejection fraction) fraction mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no LVEF is in the note, Answer 55 if the lowest value is 55% or greater.

qPLT.question: What is the lowest platelet count (PLT) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no platelet count is available in the note.

qHGB.question: What is the lowest hemoglobin (HGB) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no HGB value is available in the note.

qCREAT.question: What is the higest serum creatinine (Creat) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no creatinine value is available in the note.

qAST.question: What is the higest aspartate aminotransferase level (AST) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no AST value is available in the note.

qBILI.question: What is the higest total bilirubin (TotBili, Bili) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no bilirubin value is available in the note.
